verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of David<WH1732>, when he was in the wilderness<WH4057> of Judah<WH3063>. O God<WH430>, thou art my God<WH410>; early will I seek<WH7836> thee: my soul<WH5315> thirsteth<WH6770> for thee, my flesh<WH1320> longeth<WH3642> for thee in a dry<WH6723> and thirsty<WH5889> land<WH776>, where no<WH1097> water<WH4325> is; thirsty: Heb. weary where: without water
To see<WH7200> thy power<WH5797> and thy glory<WH3519>, so as I have seen<WH2372> thee in the sanctuary<WH6944>.
Because thy lovingkindness<WH2617> is better<WH2896> than life<WH2416>, my lips<WH8193> shall praise<WH7623> thee.
Thus will I bless<WH1288> thee while I live<WH2416>: I will lift up<WH5375> my hands<WH3709> in thy name<WH8034>.
My soul<WH5315> shall be satisfied<WH7646> as with marrow<WH2459> and fatness<WH1880>; and my mouth<WH6310> shall praise<WH1984> thee with joyful<WH7445> lips<WH8193>: marrow: Heb. fatness
When I remember<WH2142> thee upon my bed<WH3326>, and meditate<WH1897> on thee in the night watches<WH821>.
Because thou hast been my help<WH5833>, therefore in the shadow<WH6738> of thy wings<WH3671> will I rejoice<WH7442>.
My soul<WH5315> followeth hard<WH1692> after<WH310> thee: thy right hand<WH3225> upholdeth<WH8551> me.
But those that seek<WH1245> my soul<WH5315>, to destroy<WH7722> it, shall go<WH935> into the lower parts<WH8482> of the earth<WH776>.
They shall fall<WH5064> by the sword<WH3027> <WH2719>: they shall be a portion<WH4521> for foxes<WH7776>. They shall fall: Heb. They shall make him run out like water by the hands of

But the king<WH4428> shall rejoice<WH8055> in God<WH430>; every one that sweareth<WH7650> by him shall glory<WH1984>: but the mouth<WH6310> of them that speak<WH1696> lies<WH8267> shall be stopped<WH5534>.
